But how would you differentiate items which have passives that do not stack and ones that do? You couldn't just let all unique passives stack, as that would make those items overpowered compared to the items that can already stack, and you can't just prevent the passives from those items *not* stack, as they would be underpowered.

I think a better version would be one were your item slots are severely limited (like, only two slots), though you would have to either decrease the gold gain or make the games end quickly (like in Snowdown Showdown).

I came up with an idea similar to this a while ago. My way of balancing it was that the items still held their unique passives, but with each one you bought get progressively weaker less 

eg. Let's say you pick a Rabadon's
1st gives 120AP and +30%AP
2nd gives 108AP and +27%AP (10% weaker)
3rd gives 96AP and +24%AP (20% weaker)
4th gives 84AP and +21%AP (30% weaker)
5th gives 72AP and +18%AP (40% weaker)
6th gives 60AP and +15%AP (50% weaker)

So your total is: 540AP and +135%AP for a grand total of 729AP.
